ygData.subject: Re: RE: Sylly 1, Qjahe 1, Harm 1; Lady Vox 0 (truncated)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Not gameplay wise, but likability.  Everyone likes clerics, and why wouldn t they?  The fact that you get to stare at a wall all night doesn t balance the
ygData.messageBody:
> Hehe, best? Nah, bards/enchanters have the best job, as they have
> the widest spell selection.

Not gameplay wise, but likability. Everyone likes clerics, and
why wouldn't they? The fact that you get to stare at a wall all
night doesn't balance the fact that you are needed so much, I guess
I meant to say. You have some of the most desired basic traits,
yet you are like an outcast sitting in a corner. I always try to
make conversation with my cleric under those circumstances. I've
got to imagine it's pretty damn boring. In hate, there's like the
'Clerics Corner' where they all sit facing away from battle, it's
kinda funny, but sad at the same time.

> According to him he "picked the people he knew would win the
> fight". Unfortuantely his decision is going to be biased, no matter what,
> since he knows his guildmates better than anyone else.

Well, if you've got clerics waiting outside and some groups without
clerics, you'd think the groups missing clerics would bawk about it.
But if you're a big happy family, and you don't want outside help,
well that changes the scenario, which is what I believed happened.
3 bards went to Nagafen, 3 bards went to Vox. It doesn't make sense
to not utilize the people and evaluate the groupings. It's not like
I showed up late, I had been there the previous day too when we waited
for Vox to spawn. =) Hell, if you've got bards, use em.

It's funny that the first few groups went linkdead, and the secondary
groups did the bulk of the work... well not funny, ironic. Since those
first groups were the 'chosen' ones, and we were the rejects. =)

Harm.
